chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Octavio V Aguero was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on Mr. Aguero's Petition for Sentence Adjustment: 
[MK] case called at 10:04am. 
Defendant Octavio V Aguero appears via video conferencing from the Oakhill Correctional Institution, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Shawa Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.  
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
The Court summarizes its review of the Sentencing Hearing transcript and expresses its concern that the Sentence does not allow for treatment to occur in the Prison System.  
Statements given by ADA Hall and by Mr. Aguero.  
The Court grants the Petition for Sentence Adjustment. 
recess 10:11am.
Sentence adjustment review on July 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 411 S Center Ave., c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:07pm [mo]
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court with Attorney Victor M. Arellano.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski--sworn as Spanish Interpreter

As to the Pre-Sentence Investigation:
--DA Happ makes 2 clarifications to page 4
--Atty. Arellano verifies receipt
--No factual corrections to be made

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Aguero
recess: 1:38pm--reconvene:1:56pm

On Count #1, The Court sentences Mr. Aguero to   5   years & 0 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years &  0  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years &    0 months.  This sentence is to commence  FORTHWITH

Although statutorily eligible,
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  206   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To pay fine of $2,400+ costs= $4,051(incl. DNA surcharge)
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand
--all other conditions are at the discretion of the Agent

The Court orders outright, not as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 2:30pm
-- copied to DA Happ & Atty Arellano on 9/16/15
The Court orders payment of attorney fees of $2319.80
Proposed order ref attorney fees to be paid
Petition for payment of attorney fees
Order for PSI to be prepared
Letter from Attorney Arellano ref PSI
for Substitution of Attorneys. It is Ordered that Attorney Victor M. Arellano be substituted as Attorney of record for the Defendant, in place of Attorney John Marchan

Case called at 10:38 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for sentencing hearing)
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Paul Marchan and Attorney Doug Phebus on behalf of Victor Arellano. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Victim rights compliance verified, no request to be heard; Court so finds. Atty Phebus submits substitution of counsel; Mr. Aguero indicates that he has not seen substitution - Clerk shows Mr. Aguero request for substitution of counsel & provides copy to the State and Mr. Aguero. 
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Aguero confirms he wishes for substitution of counsel; No objection from State
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Phebus indicates that if the Court grants substitution, will be requesting adjournment of sentencing; No objection from State
Court presents basis, grants substitution, discharges Atty Marchan & Atty Arellano shall now be attorney of record/endorses order and adjourns sentencing hearing
Atty Marchan informs the Court of substitution procedural posture
Recess: 10:51 am

NEXT: (1) Reschedule Sentencing Hearing - Send notices **DA Happ & Defense Counsel to call Court's JA for scheduling**
Defendant's (received by fax with cover letter)
Attorney Victor M Arellano, received by fax with cover sheet and enclosure letter
Sentencing hearing on June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 17, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
with JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Cases 14CF349 and 14CM79 called at 3:15 [mo]
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court with Attorney John Marchan. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Leisl Monroy-- Sworn as Spanish Interpretor

During plea colloquy, Attorney Marchan summarizes his efforts to consult with Mr. Aguero's immigration attorney regarding any immigration- related impact a conviction in this case may have. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on  Count #1 of case 14CF349; factual basis stipulated including as to dates of prior convictions; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Case 14CM79 and Counts #2 and #3 of case 14CF349.

In response to the Court's inquires, the parties specifically waive the preparation of a Pre-Sentence Investigation. 
On Motion of the State, the Court revokes bond. Mr. Aguero will be held in custody pending a sentencing hearing.

Recess:4:00pm

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing: 4/17/2015 at 1:00pm

Case called at 4:08pm {MO]
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski---Sworn as Spanish Interpreter
ADA Hall indicates that this case is near resolution. 
Atty. Marchan agrees with the State, the this case is near resolution, but indicates he does not feel it will be ready to go to full Sentencing, but rather soley Plea on the next hearing date. 
Atty. Marchan aknowledges that the Defense is aware that the State request a revocation of  bond on entry of a plea. 
The Court will adjourn the Motion hearings and address them on the 5/9/2015 already scheduled hearing, if needed. 
The Court grants the joint recommendation of adjourning todays Motion hearing. 
recess: 4:14pm


NEXT: The 3/9/15 FSSC will now be held at 3:00 to accomodate Atty. Marchan's schedule, and the 3/12-3/13/15 Jury Trial dates remain on the calendar.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
Motion hearing on March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
States theory of admissibility of blood test result
Motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions/adjudications
Notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
Jury trial on March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on March 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

cases #14CF349 and #14CM79 called at 9:26am. [MK]
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court with Attorney John P. Marchan.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Attorney Marchan requests an adjournment of at least thirty days, explaining that Mr. Aguero has not been able to get in to see the immigration attorney; he was told to contact Attorney Castro's office again after the New Year.  Attorney Marchan has tried to reach Attorney Castro by email, but has not gotten a response yet. 
The Court informs the parties that these cases will transfer to Branch III/Judge Wambach as of January 1st. 
Mr. Aguero verifies that the 741 Pierce Street, Waterloo address is current. 
recess 9:28am. 

NEXT:  cases are referred to Branch III for further scheduling
Status conference on December 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

cases #14CF349 and #14CM79 called at 3:43pm. 
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court with Attorney John P. Marchan.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
In case #13CF349 Mr. Aguero waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment is conducted in Case #13CF349:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Attorney Marchan indicates that he is consulting with Mr. Aguero's immigration attorney about these cases. The Defense requests scheduling of a Status in December.
In response to an inquiry raised by the State, Attorney Marchan confirms that Mr. Aguero is in compliance with SCRAM monitoring; he is currently wearing the alcohol monitoring bracelet. 
The Court informs the parties that these cases will transfer to Branch III/Judge Wambach if they are still pending as of January 1st. 
recess 3:52pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/3/14 at 10:00am  (2)  schedule both cases for Status Conference on 12/23/14 at 9:00am
Order appointing counsel endorsed by Attorney Marchan w/cover letter
Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
The Court appoints attorney Marchan//repayment of attorney fees to be addressed at the conclusion of the case

Case called at 11:06 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing)
Defendant Octavio V Aguero in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Liesl Monroy sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Aguero indicates that he would like counsel in this matter, did not attempt to fill out application for Court appointed attorney, but would like Court appointed counsel.
Court has colloquy with Mr. Aguero re: finances/employment
ADA Teuber informs the Court that Atty Marchan was appointed in Mr. Aguero's other matter 14CM79
Court finds Mr. Aguero partially indigent & appoints counsel at the rate of $70 per hour and at the conclusion of case, order will be made for repayment of attys.
Mr. Aguero provides updated address
Recess: 11:13 am

Case called at 1:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Octavio V Aguero appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Aquero is eligible for SPD Representation
Court reviews copy of conflict review worksheet used in prior matter & concluded on previous matter that there was no conflict found at that time. Court continues conclusion.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; charges/penalties recited for Ct#1; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 & #2
Upon agreement of parties, preliminary hearing time limits waived

Court requires a $1000 CASH bond, with conditions:
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on the first Monday or Thursday, whichever is sooner, following release from custody at 1:00 pm. If no one is available at that time, must report to the Clerk of Court's Office to make an appointment for installation.
-  No alcohol possession or consumption. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  Not drive
